subject: [Radiance-general] conflict with the vim editor (11-Mai-2009 6:22)From:    ami guru <dosto.walla@gmail.com>
body:
Yes, it comes up in this mailing list every 1-2 months. rview has been renamed to rvu quite a long time ago just because of this confict, so please use rvu instead of rview, it should work exactly the same way.


Original Message        processed by David.InfoCenter
To:      radiance@rendigo.com


Hello forum,


With the following command the editor launches instead of the rview.

*********************
sajjad@sajjad:~/MyStuff/Radiance/chapt1$ rview -vp 2.25 .375 1 -vd -.25 .125 -.125 -av .5 .5 .5 test.oct
VIM - Vi IMproved 7.1 (2007 May 12, compiled Jan  8 2009 03:06:24)
Unknown option argument: "-.25"
More info with: "vim -h"


*******************'**


I am running ubuntu and i have installed radiance as  a debian package.


Have anyone encountered that before?


Regards
Sajjad
